exception.name: ErrorParameterMismatch
exception.description: This exception is thrown when the parameters provided to a function do not match the expected types or constraints. The mismatch could be related to parameter type incompatibility, incorrect number of parameters, or invalid parameter combinations.

javadoc.summary: This class defines the exception ErrorParameterMismatch that is thrown when function parameters do not match expected types or constraints.
javadoc.description: Indicates that a function was called with parameters that do not conform to the function's signature or constraints, such as wrong types, incorrect counts, or invalid combinations.

specification.requirement: SHALL be raised when function parameters do not match the expected types or constraints
specification.applicability: General exception - applicable to all functions with parameters

condition.description: Parameter type does not match expected type
condition.trigger: A parameter of type A is passed where type B is expected
condition.action: Validate all parameters before function execution

condition.trigger: Too many or too few parameters are provided
condition.action: Check the function signature and provide correct number of parameters

condition.trigger: A combination of valid parameters that together violate a constraint

exception.recovery: Verify the function signature, check parameter types and values, and retry the operation with correct parameters.
exception.note: This exception indicates a programming error and should not occur in production if parameters are properly validated before the function call
